lines: An exciting movie is on television. The whole family is in the living room watching it. You get up to get a drink of water and return to find all of the good seats have been taken.

When you grow up you will probably need to take an Assertiveness Training course. You miss most of the movie, laughing only when everyone else laughs. The dog comes over and sits by your leg. You can:
No need to take out your frustration on your poor pooch! Your father sees you kick the dog and sends you to your room.

You can always rely on faithful Goodo to make you feel important and worthwhile. Your Mother gets up to answer the phone and Goodo acquires her chair for you. The two of you can now watch the movie in peace.
You don't think old Dad will fall for THAT ancient trick, do you? He acts like he believes you for a second then asks Mom to answer the door. She ignores him.
She falls for it! She rushes to the door and you jump up on her seat. When she realizes what you have done, she goes over and sits on top of Dad. Everyone seems a bit happier now.
